meanings.definition: The head of a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: She gently patted her caput to show affection.
meanings.sent2: The caput houses the brain, eyes, and mouth.
meanings.sent3: The caput of the family, the dog, always gets the most attention.
meanings.sent4: His caput was filled with knowledge and wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The caput is crucial for sensing the world around us.

meanings.definition: The top or highest point of something.
meanings.sent1: The mountain's caput was covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: The caput of the tree reached towards the sky.
meanings.sent3: The caput of the tower seemed to touch the clouds.
meanings.sent4: At the caput of the hill, you could see for miles.
meanings.sent5: The caput of the flagpole waved proudly in the wind.

meanings.sent1: The wise owl was considered the caput of the forest animals.
meanings.sent2: The caput of the tribe made important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The caput of the team always led by example.
meanings.sent4: As the caput of the company, she guided it to success.
meanings.sent5: The caput of the council was respected by all.

meanings.definition: The main or central part of something.
meanings.sent1: The caput of the book contained the most exciting plot twists.
meanings.sent2: In the caput of the city, you can find all the major attractions.
meanings.sent3: The caput of the problem was finally identified.
meanings.sent4: Her caput was filled with creative ideas.
meanings.sent5: The caput of the flower held the sweetest nectar.
